alert.note: Alert for Southern Mono County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued October 20 at 1:10PM PDT until October 22 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN MONO COUNTY IN THE EASTERN SIERRA... The National Weather Service in Reno has issued a Fire Weather Watch for gusty winds and low humidity, which is in effect from late Friday night through Saturday morning. * CHANGES... * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zone 274 Southern Mono County. * Winds...Southwest 25 to 40 mph most areas, with gusts to 60 mph across mid slopes and foothills possible. Ridge wind gusts 80 to 100 mph. * Humidity...Recovery is expected to remain moderate at all elevations and generally below 40%. * Duration...3 to 6 hours. * Impacts...Strong winds of this magnitude can cause fire to rapidly grow in size and intensity before first responders can contain them.
info.instruction: Avoid outdoor activities that can cause a spark near dry vegetation, such as yard work, target shooting, or campfires. Follow local fire restrictions. Check weather.gov/reno for updates and livingwithfire.info for preparedness tips.
